narratives.question_text: Were the resources available to you - library, fabrication labs, classroom, software, desk space, etc. adequate for the fulfillment of the assigned work?  If not, please make suggestions.
comments: Yes, although the library had lost several books I needed.

I wish that Stanislas had made his lecture slides available to us to download, because they would have been a great reference to keep.We were originally assigned to have class in 211, which is a really bad room for seminars because it is too big and has no big table. Luckily, we were able to switch to the other 2nd floor room after a few weeks.

The resources for the course were entirely adequate besides the library, which as usual, felt entirely inadequate. Between the short hours, the one book policy, the 24-hour lending policy, and the fact that books are often missing, hard to find, or the library doesnt own them at all, the Arts Library is lacking in many ways that, at a school of such purportedly high quality, should be absolutely embarrassing.
